style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;reflects Pfizer&#8217;s share of the JV&#8217;s earnings that were generated in fourth-quarter 2019 (to be recorded by Pfizer in first-quarter 2020) as well as Pfizer&#8217;s share of the JV&#8217;s projected earnings during the first three quarters of 2020.</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Shift from Biopharma to Upjohn of Meridian Medical Technologies (Meridian) and the Pfizer-Mylan Strategic Collaboration in Japan (Mylan-Japan)</font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(10)</sup>&#160;</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Beginning in 2020, Upjohn began managing Pfizer&#8217;s Meridian subsidiary, the manufacturer of EpiPen and other auto-injector products, and the Mylan-Japan collaboration for generic drugs in Japan (established in 2012). As a result, revenues and expenses associated with Meridian and Mylan-Japan will be reported in Pfizer&#8217;s Upjohn business beginning in first-quarter 2020. In 2019, revenues from Meridian and Mylan-Japan were recorded in Pfizer&#8217;s Biopharma business and totaled </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$598</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;million, flat operationally, compared with full-year 2018.</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">2020 Financial Guidance for New Pfizer</font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(5)</sup>&#160;</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:32px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">CAPITAL ALLOCATION</font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" returned </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$16.9 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;directly to shareholders, through a combination of:</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td and</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td August 2019.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:16px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:30px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:6px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">The full-year 2019 diluted weighted-average shares used to calculate earnings per common share was </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">302 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;shares compared to full-year 2018.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:16px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:30px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:6px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">As of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">January&#160;28, 2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, Pfizer&#8217;s remaining share repurchase authorization was </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$5.3 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">. No share repurchases are currently planned in 2020.</font></div></td></tr></table><div><br></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">- </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">4</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;-</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><a name="s381C6D250BA75DE197C0B3361E07E747"></a></div><div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:32px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">EXECUTIVE COMMENTARY</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Dr. Albert Bourla, Pfizer&#8217;s Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, stated, &#8220;2019 was a busy year, highlighted by solid financial performance, shareholder-friendly capital allocation, the strengthening of our pipeline as well as the formation of the Consumer Healthcare JV with GSK. We also announced a definitive agreement to combine Upjohn and Mylan to create a new global pharmaceutical company, Viatris, marking an important milestone in Pfizer&#8217;s evolution toward becoming a more focused, global leader in innovative medicines.</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:16px;padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#8220;2020 is expected to be an exciting year for Pfizer with the close of the Upjohn-Mylan transaction anticipated by mid-year, leaving New Pfizer positioned to deliver revenue and Adjusted diluted EPS</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(3)</sup></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;growth that is expected to be among the industry leaders. New Pfizer will be a smaller, science-based company with a singular focus on innovation while also continuing to allocate significant capital directly to shareholders, primarily through dividends.</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:16px;padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#8220;For New Pfizer, we expect important clinical data readouts across our early-, mid- and late-stage pipeline. In the first half of 2020, we expect to report pivotal top-line results for the JADE Compare study for abrocitinib (PF-04965842), our Janus kinase-1 (JAK1) inhibitor for moderate-to-severe atopic dermatitis (AD), for three Phase 3 trials of PF-06482077, our 20-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine candidate in adults aged 18 and older, and for Xeljanz in ankylosing spondylitis, in addition to the potentially registration-enabling Phase 2 ANCHOR study evaluating the combination of Braftovi, Mektovi and cetuximab for the first-line treatment of BRAF</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">V600E</sup></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">-mutant metastatic colorectal cancer. We also expect data in the first half of 2020 for promising earlier-stage opportunities, including proof-of-concept readouts for PF-06939926, our mini-dystrophin gene therapy candidate for Duchenne muscular dystrophy, for PF-06928316, our prophylactic vaccine candidate for the prevention of respiratory syncytial virus infection, and for PF-06700841, an investigational topical TYK2/JAK1 dual inhibitor for psoriasis and AD.</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:16px;padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#8220;In the second half of 2020, we look forward to top-line results for the Phase 3 PENELOPE-B study of Ibrance in early-stage breast cancer as well as for proof-of-concept readouts for PF-06651600, our dual JAK3/TEC inhibitor as a potential treatment for vitiligo, for PF-06700841 for potential treatment of psoriatic arthritis (PsA), and for PF-06826647, our investigational TYK2 inhibitor for psoriasis. In addition, we now expect the Phase 3 PALLAS study of Ibrance in early-stage breast cancer to complete in early 2021. In 2020, we are focused on accelerating the pipeline and building on the business momentum that we generated in 2019,&#8221; Dr. Bourla concluded.</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Frank D&#8217;Amelio, Chief Financial Officer and Executive Vice President, Business Operations and Global Supply, stated, &#8220;I am pleased with our 2019 financial results, which met or exceeded all components of our financial guidance. Our Biopharma business generated </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">8%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;operational revenue growth, driven by strong growth from Ibrance, Eliquis, Xeljanz and Vyndaqel/Vyndamax. As expected, the Upjohn business declined </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">16%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;operationally, primarily reflecting the U.S. loss of exclusivity of Lyrica in July 2019. Excluding Lyrica in the U.S. and the </font></div><div><br></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">- </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">5</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;-</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">impact of other recent product losses of exclusivity, Upjohn revenues declined 3% operationally in 2019. We also returned </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$16.9 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;directly to shareholders through share repurchases and dividends, demonstrating our continued commitment to returning capital to our shareholders.</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#8220;Today we also provided 2020 financial guidance for Total Company</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(4)</sup></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, New Pfizer</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(5)</sup></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;and Upjohn</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(6)</sup></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">. The midpoint of the revenue guidance range for New Pfizer</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(5)</sup></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;implies </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">8%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;operational growth and reflects anticipated continued strong growth from certain in-line brands such as Ibrance, Eliquis, Xeljanz, Xtandi and Inlyta, from recent and expected product launches such as Vyndaqel/Vyndamax, Braftovi, Mektovi and oncology biosimilars as well as from emerging markets. Since July 2019, several of the aforementioned products have performed better than we had anticipated and have generated strong momentum that we expect to continue in 2020. The midpoint of the revenue guidance range for Upjohn</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(6)</sup></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;implies a </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">23%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;operational decline, primarily reflecting expected declines for products that have recently lost marketing exclusivity and lower revenues from China due to the geographic expansion of the volume-based procurement (VBP) program to all Chinese provinces in 2020. Importantly, the financial guidance for Upjohn</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(6)</sup></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;remains unchanged on an operational basis from the preliminary financial targets that were provided in July 2019,&#8221; Mr. D&#8217;Amelio concluded.</font></div><div><a name="s5577B8B9CD785F729DA989B89E2030F3"></a></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:32px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">QUARTERLY FINANCIAL HIGHLIGHTS (</font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Fourth-Quarter</font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">) </font></div><div style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;text-align:center;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;revenues totaled </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$12.7 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, a decrease of </font><font of foreign exchange of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$158 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, or </font><font style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Biopharma Revenue Highlights</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Fourth-quarter</font><font revenues totaled </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$10.5 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, up </font><font gains;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:16px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:60px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div transthyretin amyloid cardiomyopathy (ATTR-CM); and</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; revenues totaled </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$2.2 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, down </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">32%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;operationally, primarily driven by the expected significant volume declines for Lyrica in the U.S. due to multi-source generic competition that began in July 2019. Excluding the unfavorable impact of Lyrica in the U.S. and other recent product losses of exclusivity, fourth-quarter 2019 revenues for Upjohn declined 6% operationally.</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Fourth-quarter</font><font revenues in China declined 1% operationally, primarily driven by declines for Lipitor and Norvasc in provinces where the VBP program has been implemented, partially offset by products not impacted by the VBP implementation, including Celebrex and Viagra, as well as operational growth from Lipitor and Norvasc in provinces were VBP had not been implemented.</font></div><div style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">continued uptake for Ibrance, Eliquis, Xeljanz and Vyndaqel/Vyndamax globally;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:6px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Prevenar 13 in emerging markets; and</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:16px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:30px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:6px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Inlyta in the U.S.,</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">partially offset primarily by lower revenues for:</font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:16px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:30px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:6px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Enbrel internationally; and</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:16px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:30px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:6px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Prevnar 13 in the U.S.</font></div></td></tr></table><div><br></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">- </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">10</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;-</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Upjohn Revenue Highlights</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Full-year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;text-align:center;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;Upjohn revenues totaled </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$10.2 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, down </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">16%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;operationally, primarily driven by Lyrica in the U.S. due to multi-source generic competition that began in July 2019 and Viagra in the U.S. due to increased generic competition following its December 2017 patent expiration. Excluding the unfavorable impact of Lyrica in the U.S. and other recent product losses of exclusivity, full-year 2019 revenues for Upjohn declined 3% operationally.</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Full-year 2019 Upjohn revenues in China grew 7% operationally, primarily driven by products not impacted by the VBP implementation, including Viagra, Celebrex, Zoloft and Lyrica, as well as by Lipitor and Norvasc in provinces where the VBP program had not been implemented, partially offset by revenue declines for Lipitor and Norvasc in provinces impacted by the March 2019 VBP program implementation.</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Consumer Healthcare Revenue Highlights</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Full-year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;text-align:center;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;revenues for Consumer Healthcare totaled </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$2.1 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, down </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">40%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;operationally, reflecting the July 31, 2019 completion of the Consumer Healthcare JV transaction with GSK</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(1)</sup></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">. </font></div><div><a name="s4434DCD14A2F5B35AD63C31527768E1A"></a></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:32px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">RECENT NOTABLE DEVELOPMENTS (Since </font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">October&#160;29, 2019</font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">)</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Product Developments</font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:30px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:6px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Abrilada/Amsparity (biosimilar adalimumab)</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:60px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:36px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#8211;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">In December 2019, the Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use (CHMP) of the European Medicines Agency (EMA) adopted a positive opinion recommending the approval of Amsparity as a biosimilar to Humira</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">&#174;(13)</sup></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#160;(adalimumab) for the treatment of certain patients with RA, juvenile idiopathic arthritis, axial spondyloarthritis, PsA, psoriasis, hidradenitis suppurativa, Crohn&#8217;s disease, UC, uveitis, and pediatric plaque psoriasis. The CHMP&#8217;s opinion is now under review by the European Commission (EC) with a final decision expected in the coming months. Pfizer does not currently plan to commercialize Amsparity in the EU should it be approved by the EC due to unfavorable market conditions.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:60px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:36px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#8211;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">In November 2019, Pfizer announced that the FDA has approved Abrilada (adalimumab-afzb) as a biosimilar to Humira</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">&#174;(13)</sup></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#160;(adalimumab),&#160;for the treatment of certain patients with RA, juvenile idiopathic arthritis, PsA, ankylosing spondylitis, adult Crohn&#8217;s disease, UC and plaque psoriasis.&#160;Pfizer is working to make Abrilada available to U.S. patients as soon as feasible based on the terms of its agreement with AbbVie. Current plans are to launch Abrilada in 2023.</font></div></td></tr></table><div><br></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">- </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">11</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;-</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:30px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:6px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Bavencio (avelumab)</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:60px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:36px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#8211;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">In January 2020, EMD Serono, the biopharmaceutical business of Merck KGaA, Darmstadt, Germany in the U.S. and Canada, and Pfizer announced that the Phase 3 JAVELIN Bladder 100 study met its primary endpoint of overall survival (OS) at a planned interim analysis. In this study, patients with previously untreated locally advanced or metastatic urothelial carcinoma whose disease did not progress on induction chemotherapy and who were randomized to receive first-line maintenance therapy with Bavencio and best supportive care (BSC) lived significantly longer than those who received BSC only. A statistically significant improvement in OS was demonstrated in the Bavencio arm in each of the co-primary populations: all randomized patients and patients with PD-L1&#8211;positive tumors. The safety profile for Bavencio in the trial was consistent with that in the JAVELIN monotherapy clinical development program. The results of this study will be submitted for presentation at an upcoming medical congress and shared with the FDA and other health authorities.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:60px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:36px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#8211;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">In November 2019, EMD Serono and Pfizer announced topline results of the Phase 3 JAVELIN Gastric 100 study evaluating avelumab as first-line maintenance therapy following induction chemotherapy in patients with unresectable, locally advanced or metastatic HER2-negative gastric or gastroesophageal junction cancer versus continuation of chemotherapy or BSC. While the study showed clinical activity for avelumab in this setting, it did not meet the primary endpoints of superior OS compared with the standard of care in the overall intent-to-treat population or the PD-L1&#8211;positive population. No new safety signals were observed, and the safety profile for avelumab in this trial was consistent with that observed in the overall JAVELIN clinical development program. The results of this study will be submitted for presentation at an upcoming medical congress.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:30px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:6px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Braftovi (encorafenib) </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">-- In December 2019, Pfizer announced that the FDA accepted and granted priority review to the company&#8217;s supplemental New Drug Application (sNDA) for Braftovi in combination with Erbitux</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">&#174;</sup></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(14)</sup></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#160;(cetuximab) based on results from the Phase 3 BEACON CRC trial, which evaluated the efficacy and safety of Braftovi in combination with Erbitux with or without Mektovi&#160;(binimetinib) in patients with advanced&#160;BRAF</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">V600E</sup></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">-mutant metastatic colorectal cancer (mCRC), following one or two lines of therapy. The sNDA has a Prescription Drug User Fee Act goal date for a decision by the FDA in April 2020.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:30px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:6px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Eliquis (apixaban)</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;-- In December 2019, the Bristol-Myers Squibb-Pfizer alliance announced results at the American Society of Hematology Annual Meeting (ASH Conference) for retrospective real-world data analyses reporting outcomes on the safety and effectiveness of Eliquis compared to low molecular weight heparin (LMWH) or warfarin for the treatment of venous thromboembolism (VTE) in patients with active cancer. Results from the primary analysis showed that Eliquis use was associated with lower rates of major bleeding, clinically-relevant non-major (CRNM) bleeding and recurrent VTE compared to LMWH. Eliquis was also associated with a lower rate of recurrent VTE and similar rates of major bleeding and CRNM bleeding compared to warfarin. In a second oral presentation at the ASH Conference, results from a subgroup </font></div></td></tr></table><div><br></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">- </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">12</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;-</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-left:30px;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">analysis of the primary study were highlighted based on different levels of risk for developing recurrent VTE. Study findings were generally consistent with the primary analysis.</font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:30px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:6px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Vyndaqel (tafamidis)</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;-- In December 2019, Pfizer announced that the CHMP of the EMA adopted a positive opinion recommending the approval of Vyndaqel, a once-daily 61 mg oral capsule, for the treatment of wild-type or hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis in adult patients with cardiomyopathy. The CHMP&#8217;s opinion is now under review by the EC with a final decision expected in coming months.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:30px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:6px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Xeljanz (tofacitinib)</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:60px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:36px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#8211;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">In December 2019, Pfizer announced that the FDA approved Xeljanz XR extended-release 11 mg and 22 mg tablets for the once-daily treatment of adult patients with moderately to severely active UC, after an inadequate response or intolerance to TNF blockers.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:60px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:36px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#8211;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">In November 2019, Pfizer announced that the CHMP of the EMA adopted a final opinion following the re-evaluation of the benefit/risk of the three approved indications of Xeljanz in the European Union (EU). This re-evaluation was initiated following Pfizer&#8217;s initial announcement regarding the increased occurrence of pulmonary embolism and an increase in overall mortality with Xeljanz 10 mg twice daily found in an ongoing postmarketing requirement study (A3921133) in RA patients 50 years of age or older with at least one cardiovascular risk factor. The CHMP opinion was forwarded to the EC which is expected to issue, by the end of January 2020 or in February 2020, a final legally binding decision applicable in all EU Member States. The EMA recommended that Xeljanz should be used with caution in patients at high risk of blood clots. In addition, maintenance doses of 10 mg twice daily are not recommended in patients with UC who are at high risk of blood clots unless there is no suitable alternative treatment. Five mg twice daily should not be exceeded for RA or PsA. Patients should be advised of the risk of VTE and should seek immediate medical treatment if symptoms develop during treatment. Further, the EMA is recommending that, due to increased risk of infections, patients older than 65 years of age should be treated with Xeljanz only when there is no suitable alternative treatment. The recommendations in this final CHMP opinion replace the provisional measures put in place at the start of the review in May 2019 which contraindicated the 10 mg twice daily dose of Xeljanz for patients at high risk of blood clots in the lungs. The CHMP is recommending removal of that contraindication. The changes come into force when the EC issues its decision.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:60px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:36px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#8211;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">In November 2019, Pfizer presented positive results from a Phase 3 investigational study of tofacitinib in children and adolescents aged two to less than 18 with polyarticular juvenile idiopathic arthritis (pa-JIA) during a late-breaking oral presentation at the American College of Rheumatology/Association of Rheumatology Professionals Annual Meeting. The trial met its primary endpoint showing that in patients with pa-JIA, the occurrence of disease flare in patients treated with tofacitinib was significantly lower than patients treated with placebo at week 44. The most common adverse events in this study in any treatment group were upper respiratory tract infection, headache, nasopharyngitis, nausea, pyrexia, </font></div></td></tr></table><div><br></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">- </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">13</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;-</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-left:60px;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">disease progression, vomiting and pa-JIA. There were no cases of death, major adverse cardiovascular events, malignancies, thrombosis, opportunistic infection or tuberculosis. Pfizer intends to submit regulatory applications for this indication in 2020.</font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:30px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:6px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Xtandi (enzalutamide)</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;-- In December 2019, Astellas Pharma Inc. and Pfizer announced that the FDA approved a sNDA for Xtandi for the treatment of patients with metastatic castration-sensitive prostate cancer (mCSPC). In 2019, it is estimated that just over 40,000 men in the U.S. are living with mCSPC, a form of prostate cancer that has spread to other parts of the body and still responds to a medical or surgical treatment that lowers testosterone.</font></div></td></tr></table><div><a name="s550C1A908B525A958435834A8AAD28BB"></a></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Pipeline Developments</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">A comprehensive update of Pfizer&#8217;s development pipeline was published today and is now available at www.pfizer.com/science/drug-product-pipeline. It includes an overview of Pfizer&#8217;s research and a list of compounds in development with targeted indication and phase of development, as well as mechanism of action for some candidates in Phase 1 and all candidates from Phase 2 through registration.</font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:4px;padding-bottom:12px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:30px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:6px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">PF-07055480 (SB-525)</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#160;-- In December 2019, in a poster presentation at the ASH&#160;Conference, Sangamo Therapeutics, Inc.&#160;and&#160;Pfizer presented updated follow-up results from the Phase 1/2 Alta study evaluating investigational SB-525 gene therapy in patients with severe hemophilia A. The data showed that SB-525 was generally well tolerated and demonstrated sustained increased Factor VIII levels following treatment with SB-525 through to 44 weeks, the extent of follow-up for the longest treated patient in the 3e13 vg/kg dose cohort. In addition, the manufacturing technology transfer and the transfer of the Investigational New Drug application to&#160;Pfizer were completed in fourth-quarter 2019.</font></div></td></tr></table><div><a name="s983A2C64556E54DB984733661DEE21BC"></a></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Corporate Developments</font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:4px;padding-bottom:12px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:30px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:6px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">In December 2019, Pfizer and Theravance Biopharma Ireland Limited, a subsidiary of Theravance Biopharma, Inc. (Theravance Biopharma) announced that the companies have entered into a global license agreement for Theravance Biopharma&#8217;s preclinical program for skin-targeted, locally-acting pan-Janus kinase (JAK) inhibitors that can be rapidly metabolized. The compounds in this program target validated pro-inflammatory pathways and are specifically designed to possess skin-selective activity with minimal systemic exposure. Under the terms of the agreement, Theravance Biopharma received an upfront cash payment of $10 million and is eligible to receive up to an additional $240 million in development and sales milestone payments from Pfizer. In addition, Theravance Biopharma will be eligible to receive royalties on worldwide net sales of any potential products emerging from the program.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:4px;padding-bottom:12px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:30px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:6px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">In December 2019, Pfizer and Mylan N.V. (Mylan) announced that Ian Read, Pfizer&#8217;s former Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, and James Kilts, a Pfizer director since 2007, will join the board of directors of Viatris, the company to be formed by the planned combination of Mylan and Upjohn, upon completion of the </font></div></td></tr></table><div><br></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">- </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">14</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;-</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-left:30px;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:4px;text-align:left;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">transaction, which is anticipated to occur in mid-2020. As previously announced, upon the completion of the transaction, Robert J. Coury will serve as the Executive Chairman of the Viatris board and Michael Goettler, current Group President, Upjohn, will serve as Chief Executive Officer and board member. Also, as previously announced, Ian Read retired from Pfizer&#8217;s board on December 31, 2019. James Kilts will cease being a member of Pfizer&#8217;s board immediately upon the closing of the transaction.</font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:4px;padding-bottom:12px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:30px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:6px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">In December 2019, Pfizer announced plans to host an Investor Day to showcase the company&#8217;s mid-to-late-stage R&amp;D pipeline progress and commercial momentum across its Biopharma businesses, to be held on Tuesday, March 31, 2020 at its global headquarters in New York, NY. Pfizer business executives and scientific leadership will provide updates on the company&#8217;s progress in advancing its R&amp;D pipeline, specifically on product candidates with blockbuster potential that are expected to launch by 2025.</font></div></td></tr></table><div><br></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">- </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">15</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;-</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><a name="s709A95DD03E6565598C932BBBFB30A8E"></a></div><div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">For additional details, see the attached financial schedules, product revenue tables and disclosure notice.</font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:16px;padding-bottom:16px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:42px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:6px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">(1)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">The following acquisitions and divestitures impacted financial results for the periods presented:</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:16px;padding-bottom:16px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:72px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:48px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">On July 31, 2019, Pfizer and GlaxoSmithKline plc (GSK) completed a transaction that combined the two companies&#8217; respective consumer healthcare businesses into a joint venture (JV), operating under the GSK Consumer Healthcare name. In exchange for contributing its Consumer Healthcare business to the JV, Pfizer received a 32% equity stake in the JV and GSK owns the remaining 68% of the JV.</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;Upon the closing of the transaction, Pfizer deconsolidated its Consumer Healthcare business and recognized a pre-tax gain of $8.1 billion ($5.4 billion net of tax) in third-quarter 2019, reflecting the difference in the fair value of Pfizer&#8217;s 32% equity stake in the JV and the carrying value of its Consumer Healthcare business. In accordance with Pfizer&#8217;s domestic and international reporting periods</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(7)</sup></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, Pfizer&#8217;s financial results, and our Consumer Healthcare segment&#8217;s operating results, for full-year 2019 reflect seven months of Consumer Healthcare segment domestic operations and eight months of Consumer Healthcare segment international operations. Pfizer records its share of earnings from the Consumer Healthcare JV on a quarterly basis on a one-quarter lag in Other (income)/deductions</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9.5pt;">&#8211;&#8211;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">net commencing from August 1, 2019. Therefore, Pfizer recorded its share of two months of the JV&#8217;s earnings generated in third-quarter 2019 in Pfizer&#8217;s operating results in fourth-quarter 2019.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:16px;padding-bottom:16px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:72px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:48px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">On July 30, 2019, Pfizer announced the successful completion of its acquisition of Array BioPharma Inc.</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;(Array). Array&#8217;s portfolio included the approved combined use of Braftovi (encorafenib) and Mektovi (binimetinib) for the treatment of BRAF</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">V600E</sup></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">- or BRAF</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><sup melanoma.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:16px;padding-bottom:16px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td AG.</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:16px;padding-bottom:16px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:42px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:6px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">(2)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Revenues is defined as revenues in accordance with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP).&#160;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Reported net income/(loss) is defined as net income/(loss) attributable to Pfizer Inc. in accordance with U.S. GAAP.&#160;Reported diluted earnings per share (EPS) and reported loss per share (LPS) are defined as diluted EPS or LPS attributable to Pfizer Inc. common shareholders in accordance with U.S. GAAP.</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:16px;padding-bottom:16px;font-family:Times New Roman; income and its components and Adjusted diluted EPS are defined as reported U.S. GAAP net income/(loss)</font><font style="font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(2)</sup></font><font style="font-size:11pt;">&#32;and its components and reported diluted EPS/(LPS)</font><font style="font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(2)</sup></font><font style="font-size:11pt;">&#32;excluding purchase accounting adjustments, acquisition-related costs, discontinued operations and certain significant items (some of which may recur, such as gains on the completion of joint venture transactions, restructuring charges, legal </font></div></td></tr></table><div><br></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">- </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">16</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;-</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-left:42px;padding-bottom:16px;padding-top:16px;text-align:left;"><font style="font-size:11pt;">charges or net gains and losses on investments in equity securities, but which management does not believe are reflective of ongoing core operations).&#160;Adjusted cost of sales, Adjusted selling, informational and administrative (SI&amp;A) expenses, Adjusted research and development (R&amp;D) expenses and Adjusted other (income)/deductions are income statement line items prepared on the same basis as, and therefore components of, the overall Adjusted income measure.</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#160;As described in the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">Financial Review&#8211;&#8211;Non-GAAP Financial Measure (Adjusted Income) </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">section of Pfizer&#8217;s 2018 Financial Report, which was filed as Exhibit 13 to Pfizer&#8217;s Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2018, management uses Adjusted income, among other factors, to set performance goals and to measure the performance of the overall company.&#160;Because Adjusted income is an important internal measurement for Pfizer, management believes that investors&#8217; understanding of our performance is enhanced by disclosing this performance measure.&#160;Pfizer reports Adjusted income, certain components of Adjusted income, and Adjusted diluted EPS in order to portray the results of the company&#8217;s major operations&#8211;&#8211;the discovery, development, manufacture, marketing and sale of prescription medicines and vaccines&#8211;&#8211;prior to considering certain income statement elements.&#160;See the accompanying reconciliations of certain GAAP Reported to Non-GAAP Adjusted information for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">fourth quarter and full year</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;text-align:center;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;text-align:center;">2018</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">. The Adjusted income and its components and Adjusted diluted EPS measures are not, and should not be viewed as, substitutes for U.S. GAAP net income and its components and diluted EPS.</font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:16px;padding-bottom:16px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:42px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:6px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">(4)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Financial guidance for Total Company reflects a full-year 2020 contribution from Biopharma and Upjohn, the current construct of the company, and excludes any impact from the pending Upjohn combination with Mylan.</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:16px;padding-bottom:16px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:42px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:6px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">(5)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Financial guidance for New Pfizer reflects a full-year 2020 pro forma view of the company assuming the pending Upjohn combination with Mylan was completed at the beginning of 2020. Therefore, New Pfizer reflects contributions from the Biopharma business as it is presently being managed, which excludes contributions from Pfizer&#8217;s Meridian subsidiary and the Pfizer-Mylan strategic collaboration in Japan (Mylan-Japan). Pfizer&#8217;s Meridian subsidiary and Mylan-Japan were managed by Pfizer&#8217;s Biopharma business in 2019. combination with Mylan:</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:12px;padding-bottom:12px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td Pfizer&#8217;s share of the earnings generated by the Consumer Healthcare JV</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><sup style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">- </font><font
