first-quarter 2020) as well as Pfizer&#8217;s share of the JV&#8217;s projected earnings during the first three quarters of 2020.</font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:16px;padding-bottom:16px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:42px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:6px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">(6)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Financial guidance for Upjohn assumes a full-year 2020 contribution from the Upjohn business as it is presently being managed, which includes contributions from Pfizer&#8217;s Meridian subsidiary and the Pfizer-Mylan strategic collaboration in Japan (Mylan-Japan). Pfizer&#8217;s Meridian subsidiary and Mylan-Japan were managed by Pfizer&#8217;s Biopharma business in 2019.</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:16px;padding-bottom:16px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:42px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:6px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">(7)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Pfizer&#8217;s fiscal year-end for international subsidiaries is November 30 while Pfizer&#8217;s fiscal year-end for U.S. subsidiaries is December 31. Therefore, Pfizer&#8217;s </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">fourth quarter and full year</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;for U.S. subsidiaries reflects the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">three and twelve months</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;ending on </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">December&#160;31, 2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;text-align:center;">December&#160;31, 2018</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;while Pfizer&#8217;s </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">fourth quarter and full year</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;for subsidiaries operating outside the U.S. reflects the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">three and twelve months</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;ending on </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">November&#160;30, 2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">November&#160;30, 2018</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:16px;padding-bottom:16px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:42px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:6px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">(8)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">References to operational variances in this press release pertain to period-over-period growth rates that exclude the impact of foreign exchange. The operational variances are determined by multiplying or dividing, as appropriate, the current period U.S. dollar results by the current period average foreign exchange rates and then multiplying or dividing, as appropriate, those amounts by the prior-year period average foreign exchange rates. Although exchange rate changes are part of Pfizer&#8217;s business, they are not within Pfizer&#8217;s control. Exchange rate changes, however, can mask positive or negative trends in the business; therefore, Pfizer believes presenting operational variances provides useful information in evaluating the results of its business.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:16px;padding-bottom:16px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:42px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:6px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">(9)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Pfizer does not provide guidance for GAAP Reported financial measures (other than revenues) or a reconciliation of forward-looking non-GAAP financial measures to the most directly comparable GAAP Reported financial measures on a forward-looking basis because it is unable to predict with reasonable certainty the ultimate outcome of pending litigation, unusual gains and losses, acquisition-related expenses, net gains or losses on investments in equity securities and potential future asset impairments without unreasonable effort. These items are uncertain, depend on various factors, and could have a material impact on GAAP Reported results for the guidance period.</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:16px;padding-top:16px;text-align:left;padding-left:42px;text-indent:48px;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">The 2020 financial guidance for Total Company reflects the following:</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;</font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:12px;padding-bottom:12px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:72px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:48px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Does not assume the completion of any business development transactions&#160;not completed as of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">December&#160;31, 2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, including any one-time upfront payments associated with such transactions.</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:12px;padding-bottom:12px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:72px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:48px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-size:11pt;">Includes Pfizer&#8217;s pro rata share of the Consumer Healthcare JV</font><font style="font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(1)</sup></font><font style="font-size:11pt;">&#32;anticipated earnings, which is recorded in Adjusted other (income)/deductions</font><font style="font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(3)</sup></font><font style="font-size:11pt;">&#32;on a one-quarter lag. Therefore, 2020 financial guidance for Adjusted other (income)/deductions</font><font style="font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(3)</sup></font><font style="font-size:11pt;">&#32;and Adjusted diluted EPS</font><font style="font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(3)</sup></font><font style="font-size:11pt;">&#32;reflects Pfizer&#8217;s share </font></div></td></tr></table><div><br></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">- </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">18</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;-</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-left:72px;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;"><font style="font-size:11pt;">of the JV&#8217;s earnings that were generated in fourth-quarter 2019 (to be recorded by Pfizer in first-quarter 2020) as well as Pfizer&#8217;s share of the JV&#8217;s projected earnings during first three quarters of 2020.</font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:12px;padding-bottom:12px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:72px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:48px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Reflects an anticipated negative revenue impact of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$2.4 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">due to recent and expected generic and biosimilar competition for certain products that have recently lost or are anticipated to soon lose patent protection. </font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:12px;padding-bottom:12px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:72px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:48px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Exchange rates assumed are as of mid-January 2020. Reflects the anticipated unfavorable impact of approximately </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$0.2 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;on revenues and approximately </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$0.01</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;on Adjusted diluted EPS</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(3)</sup></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">as a result of changes in foreign exchange rates relative to the U.S. dollar compared to foreign exchange rates from 2019.</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:12px;padding-bottom:12px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:72px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:48px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Guidance for Adjusted diluted EPS</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(3)</sup></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">assumes diluted weighted-average shares outstanding of approximately</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">5.65</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;billion shares, </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">which assumes no share repurchases in 2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">. </font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:16px;padding-bottom:16px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:42px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:6px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">(10)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Pfizer, Upjohn and Mylan are in the process of negotiating the terms on which Pfizer would transfer the Meridian business and/or certain Pfizer assets that currently form part of the Mylan-Japan collaboration&#160;to Viatris&#160;following the completion of the proposed combination of Upjohn and Mylan.&#160;There can be no&#160;assurance&#160;that any&#160;agreement&#160;or transaction will result from these negotiations and if the parties are unsuccessful in their efforts to negotiate the terms of such potential transactions, the Meridian business and/or the Pfizer assets that currently form part of the Mylan-Japan collaboration will remain with Pfizer.</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:16px;padding-bottom:16px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:42px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:6px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">(11)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-size:11pt;">Adjusted income</font><font style="font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(3)</sup></font><font style="font-size:11pt;">&#32;before tax margin (Adjusted IBT margin) is defined as revenue less the sum of Adjusted cost of sales</font><font style="font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(3)</sup></font><font style="font-size:11pt;">, Adjusted SI&amp;A expenses</font><font style="font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(3)</sup></font><font style="font-size:11pt;">, Adjusted R&amp;D expenses</font><font style="font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(3)</sup></font><font style="font-size:11pt;">, Adjusted amortization of intangible assets</font><font style="font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(3)</sup></font><font style="font-size:11pt;">&#32;and Adjusted other (income)/deductions</font><font style="font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(3)</sup></font><font style="font-size:11pt;">&#32;as a percentage of revenue. Adjusted IBT Margin is presented because management believes this performance measure supplements investors&#8217; and other readers&#8217; understanding and assessment of the financial performance of New Pfizer</font><font style="font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(5)</sup></font><font style="font-size:11pt;">. Adjusted IBT margin is not, and should not be viewed as, a substitute for U.S. GAAP income before tax margin.</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:16px;padding-bottom:16px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:42px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:6px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">(12)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-size:11pt;">Adjusted Earnings Before Interest, Tax, Depreciation and Amortization (EBITDA) is defined as reported U.S. GAAP net income/(loss)</font><font style="font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(2)</sup></font><font style="font-size:11pt;">, and its components, adjusted for interest expense, provision/(benefit) for taxes on income/(loss) and depreciation and amortization, further adjusted to exclude purchase accounting adjustments, acquisition-related costs, discontinued operations and certain significant items (some of which may recur, such as gains on the completion of joint venture transactions, restructuring charges, legal charges or net gains and losses on investments in equity securities, but which management does not believe are reflective of ongoing core operations). Adjusted EBITDA is presented because management believes this performance measure supplements investors&#8217; and other readers&#8217; understanding and assessment of the </font></div></td></tr></table><div><br></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">- </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">19</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;-</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-left:42px;padding-bottom:16px;padding-top:16px;text-align:left;"><font style="font-size:11pt;">financial performance of Upjohn. Adjusted EBITDA as defined is not a measurement of financial performance under GAAP, and should not be considered as an alternative to net income/(loss)</font><font style="font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(2)</sup></font><font style="font-size:11pt;">&#32;or cash flow from operations determined in accordance with GAAP. </font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:16px;padding-bottom:16px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:42px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td AND SUBSIDIARY COMPANIES</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED STATEMENTS OF INCOME</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">(UNAUDITED)</font></div></div><div><br></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:0px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:36px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:0px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">(1)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The financial statements present the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">three and twelve months</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;ended </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;text-align:center;">December&#160;31, 2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;text-align:center;">December&#160;31, 2018</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. Subsidiaries operating outside the U.S. are included for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">three and twelve months</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;ended </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">November&#160;30, 2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">November&#160;30, 2018</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:0px;text-align:left;padding-left:36px;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">On July 31, 2019, we completed the transaction in which we and GlaxoSmithKline plc (GSK) combined our respective consumer healthcare businesses into a new consumer healthcare joint venture that operates globally under the GSK Consumer Healthcare name. In exchange for contributing our Consumer Healthcare business to the joint venture, we received a 32% equity stake in the new company and GSK owns the remaining 68%. Upon the closing of the transaction, we deconsolidated our Consumer Healthcare business and recognized a pre-tax gain of</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$8.1 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;(</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$5.4 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">net of tax)</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">in our fiscal third quarter of 2019 in (</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Gain) on completion of Consumer Healthcare JV transaction </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">for the difference in the fair value of our 32% equity stake in the new company and the carrying value of our Consumer Healthcare business. In accordance with our domestic and international reporting periods, our financial results, and our Consumer Healthcare segment&#8217;s operating results, for full-year 2019 reflect seven months of Consumer Healthcare segment domestic operations and eight months of Consumer Healthcare segment international operations. We record our share of earnings from the Consumer Healthcare joint venture on a quarterly basis on a one-quarter lag in </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Other (income)/deductions&#8211;&#8211;net</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;commencing from August 1, 2019. Therefore, we recorded our share of two months of the joint venture&#8217;s earnings generated in the third quarter of 2019 in our operating results in the fourth quarter of 2019.</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;See footnote (5) below.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:0px;text-align:left;padding-left:36px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The financial results of Array BioPharma Inc. (Array) are included in our consolidated financial statements commencing from the acquisition date of July 30, 2019.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:0px;text-align:left;padding-left:36px;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The financial results of Therachon Holding AG (Therachon) are included in our consolidated financial statements commencing from the acquisition date of July 1, 2019. Therefore, in accordance with our international reporting period, our financial results for the</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">fourth quarter</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;of 2019 reflect three months</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">and for </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">full-year</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;reflect five months of Therachon operations. In connection with this asset acquisition, we recorded</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;a charge of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$337 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">in </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Research and development expenses </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">in our fiscal third quarter of 2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:0px;text-align:left;padding-left:36px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Certain amounts in the consolidated statements of income and associated notes may not add due to rounding. All percentages have been calculated using unrounded amounts.</font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:0px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:36px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:0px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">(2)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Exclusive of amortization of intangible assets, except as discussed in footnote (3) below.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:0px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:36px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:0px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">(3)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Amortization expense related to finite-lived acquired intangible assets that contribute to our ability to sell, manufacture, research, market and distribute products, compounds and intellectual property is included in </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Amortization of intangible assets,</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;as these intangible assets benefit multiple business functions. Amortization expense related to intangible assets that are associated with a single function is included in </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Cost of sales</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">,</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">&#32;Selling</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">(a)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Restructuring charges/(credits)</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">&#8211;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">&#8211;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">acquisition-related costs include employee termination costs, asset impairments and other exit costs associated with business combinations. Credits for </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">full-year</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">were mostly due to the reversal of certain accruals related to our acquisition of Wyeth upon the effective favorable settlement of a U.S. Internal Revenue Service (IRS) audit for multiple tax years.</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;See footnote (6) below. Charges for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">fourth quarter</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2018</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">were primarily due to asset write downs related to our acquisition of Hospira, Inc. (Hospira), and charges for </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">full-year</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2018</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">were mainly due to asset write downs, partially offset by the reversal of previously recorded accruals for employee termination costs related to our acquisition of Hospira</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.</font></div></td></tr></table><div><br></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">- </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">22</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;-</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:3pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:3pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">PFIZER INC. AND SUBSIDIARY COMPANIES</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED STATEMENTS OF INCOME</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">(UNAUDITED)</font></div></div><div><br></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:0px;padding-bottom:1px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:60px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:36px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">(b)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Restructuring charges</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">&#8211;&#8211;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">cost reduction initiatives relate to employee termination costs, asset impairments and other exit costs not associated with acquisitions. For the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">fourth quarter</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">full-year</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">the charges were mostly related to employee termination costs</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. For the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">fourth quarter</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and </font><font </font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:0px;padding-bottom:0px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td and other were mostly related to our acquisitions of Array and Hospira.</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;In the </font><font In the fourth quarter of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2018</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, primarily included legal reserves for certain pending legal matters. font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:60px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:36px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">(g)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">In the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">fourth quarter</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and full-year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, primarily includes an intangible asset impairment charge of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$2.6 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">related to Eucrisa, a Biopharma finite-lived developed technology right acquired in connection with our </font></div></td></tr></table><div><br></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">- </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">23</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;-</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:3pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:3pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">PFIZER INC. AND SUBSIDIARY COMPANIES</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED STATEMENTS OF INCOME</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">(UNAUDITED)</font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-left:60px;padding-bottom:1px;padding-top:0px;text-align:left;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">acquisition of Anacor Pharmaceuticals, Inc., and reflects updated commercial forecasts mainly reflecting competitive pressures.</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;In </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">full-year</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, also includes intangible asset impairment charges of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$181 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$90 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;of which represents in-process research and development (IPR&amp;D) related to a pre-clinical stage asset from our acquisition of Bamboo Therapeutics, Inc. for gene therapies for the potential treatment of patients with certain rare diseases.</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;In the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">fourth quarter</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">full-year</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;2018, primarily included intangible asset impairment charges of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$3.1 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, mainly composed of (i) </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$2.6 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;related to developed technology rights, </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$242 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;related to licensing agreements and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$80 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;related to IPR&amp;D, all of which related to our acquisition of Hospira, for generic sterile injectable products associated with various indications and (ii) </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$117 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;related to a multi-antigen vaccine IPR&amp;D program for adults undergoing elective spinal fusion surgery. In 2018, the intangible asset impairment charges associated with the generic sterile injectable products reflect, among other things, updated commercial forecasts, reflecting an increased competitive environment as well as higher manufacturing costs, largely stemming from manufacturing and supply issues. The intangible asset impairment charge for the multi-antigen vaccine IPR&amp;D program was the result of the Phase 2b trial reaching futility at a pre-planned interim analysis.</font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:0px;padding-bottom:1px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:60px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:36px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">(h)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">In the fourth quarter of 2018 and full-year 2018 and 2019, mainly represents incremental costs associated with the design, planning and implementation of our new organizational structure, effective in the beginning of 2019, and primarily includes consulting, legal, tax and advisory services.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:0px;padding-bottom:1px;font-family:Times New Roman; accordance with guidance issued by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, (ii) the change in the jurisdictional mix of earnings as a result of operating fluctuations in the normal course of business, as well as (iii) the resolution of certain tax positions pertaining to prior years primarily with various foreign tax authorities, and the expiration of certain statutes of limitations.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:0px;padding-bottom:0px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">- </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">26</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;-</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><a name="sA7BB87E05E33564980D5EB3AF0C31A85"></a></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:3pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:3pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">PFIZER INC. AND SUBSIDIARY COMPANIES</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">NOTES TO RECONCILIATION OF GAAP REPORTED TO NON-GAAP ADJUSTED INFORMATION</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">CERTAIN LINE ITEMS - (UNAUDITED)</font></div></div><div><br></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:0px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:36px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:0px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">(1)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">In 2018, Pfizer&#8217;s Non-GAAP Adjusted results included net gains on investments in equity securities, which favorably impacted full-year 2018 Adjusted </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Other (Income)/Deductions</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;by $586 million and Adjusted Diluted EPS by $0.08. </font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-left:4px;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:0px;text-align:left;padding-left:36px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Beginning in 2019, Pfizer excludes net gains and losses on investments in equity securities from Non-GAAP Adjusted results because of their inherent volatility, which is outside of Pfizer management&#8217;s control and cannot be predicted with any level of certainty. Additionally, Pfizer management does not believe that including these gains and losses assists investors in understanding Pfizer's business or is reflective of its core operations. Non-GAAP Adjusted financial results for fourth-quarter and full-year 2018 have been revised from previously reported amounts to conform with the 2019 presentation. See Note (4) below for additional information.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:0px;text-align:left;padding-left:36px;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">On July 31, 2019, we completed the transaction in which we and GlaxoSmithKline plc (GSK) combined our respective consumer healthcare businesses into a new consumer healthcare joint venture that operates globally under the GSK Consumer Healthcare name. In exchange for contributing our Consumer Healthcare business to the joint venture, we received a 32% equity stake in the new company and GSK owns the remaining 68%. Upon the closing of the transaction, we deconsolidated our Consumer Healthcare business and recognized a pre-tax gain of</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$8.1 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;(</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$5.4 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">net of tax)</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">in our fiscal third quarter of 2019 in (</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Gain) on completion of Consumer Healthcare JV transaction </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">for the difference in the fair value of our 32% equity stake in the new company and the carrying value of our Consumer Healthcare business. In accordance with our domestic and international reporting periods, our financial results, and our Consumer Healthcare segment&#8217;s operating results, for full-year 2019 reflect seven months of Consumer Healthcare segment domestic operations and eight months of Consumer Healthcare segment international operations. We record our share of earnings from the Consumer Healthcare joint venture on a quarterly basis on a one-quarter lag in </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Other (income)/deductions&#8211;&#8211;net</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;commencing from August 1, 2019. Therefore, we recorded our share of two months of the joint venture&#8217;s earnings generated in the third quarter of 2019 in our operating results in the fourth quarter of 2019.</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;For the non-GAAP measure of Adjusted Earnings, see footnote (5) below, our share of certain charges recognized by the joint venture primarily related to restructuring activities and business combination accounting are excluded from the measure. The gain generated from the contribution of our Consumer Healthcare business was also excluded from Adjusted Income.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:0px;text-align:left;padding-left:36px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The financial results of Array BioPharma Inc. (Array) are included in our consolidated financial statements commencing from the acquisition date of July 30, 2019.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:0px;text-align:left;padding-left:36px;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The financial results of Therachon Holding AG (Therachon) are included in our consolidated financial statements commencing from the acquisition date of July 1, 2019. Therefore, in accordance with our international reporting period, our financial results for the</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">fourth quarter</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">of 2019 reflect three months and for </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">full-year</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;reflect five months of Therachon operations. In connection with this asset acquisition, we recorded</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;a charge of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$337 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">in </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Research and development expenses </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">in our fiscal third quarter of 2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-left:4px;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:0px;text-align:left;padding-left:36px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Certain amounts in the reconciliation of GAAP reported to Non-GAAP adjusted information and associated notes may not add due to rounding. </font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:0px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:36px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:0px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">(2)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The financial statements present the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">three and twelve months</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;ended </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;text-align:center;">December&#160;31, 2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;text-align:center;">December&#160;31, 2018</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. Subsidiaries operating outside the U.S. are included for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">three and twelve months</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;ended </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">November&#160;30, 2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">November&#160;30, 2018</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:left;padding-left:36px;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">.</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;In the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">fourth quarter</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and full-year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, primarily includes an intangible asset impairment charge of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$2.6 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">related to Eucrisa, a Biopharma finite-lived developed technology right acquired in connection with our acquisition of Anacor Pharmaceuticals, Inc., and reflects updated commercial forecasts mainly reflecting competitive pressures.</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;In full-year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, also includes intangible asset impairment charges of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$181 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$90 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;of which represents in-process research and development (IPR&amp;D) related to a pre-clinical stage asset from our acquisition of Bamboo Therapeutics, Inc. for gene therapies for the potential treatment of patients with certain rare diseases.</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;In the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">fourth quarter</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">full-year</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;2018, primarily includes intangible asset impairment charges of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$3.1 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, mainly composed of (i) </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$2.6 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;related to developed technology rights, </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$242 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;related to licensing agreements and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$80 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;related to IPR&amp;D, all of which relate to our acquisition of Hospira, for generic sterile injectable products associated with various indications and (ii) </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$117 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;related to a multi-antigen vaccine IPR&amp;D program for adults undergoing elective spinal fusion surgery. In 2018, the intangible asset impairment charges associated with the generic sterile injectable products reflect, among other things, updated commercial forecasts, reflecting an increased competitive environment as well as higher manufacturing costs, largely stemming from manufacturing and supply issues. The intangible asset impairment charge for the multi-antigen vaccine IPR&amp;D program was the result of the Phase 2b trial reaching futility at a pre-planned interim analysis.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:0px;padding-bottom:1px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:60px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:36px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">(e)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">In the fourth quarter of 2019, primarily included in </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Cost of sales </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">(</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$15 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">) and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Selling, informational and administrative expenses </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">(</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$128 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">)</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">and mostly represents separation costs associated with our planned Upjohn transaction with Mylan, and mainly includes consulting, legal, tax and advisory services. our allogeneic chimeric antigen receptor T cell therapy development program assets in connection with our asset contribution agreement entered into with Allogene Therapeutics, Inc.</font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:0px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:60px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:36px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">(j)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Included in </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Provision/(benefit) for taxes on income/(loss)</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. Income taxes includes the tax effect of the associated pre-tax amounts, calculated by determining the jurisdictional location of the pre-tax amounts and applying that jurisdiction&#8217;s applicable tax rate.</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Also included is the effect of certain U.S. tax consequences. The fourth-quarter and full-year 2019 were favorably impacted by the benefits related to certain tax initiatives associated with the implementation of our new organizational structure.</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;Full-year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;text-align:center;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">was unfavorably impacted by the tax expense associated with the gain related to the completion of the Consumer Healthcare joint venture transaction with GSK and favorably impacted by a benefit of $1.4 billion, representing tax and interest, resulting from the favorable settlement of a U.S. IRS audit for multiple tax years, as well as the tax benefit recorded as a result of additional guidance issued by the U.S. Department of Treasury related to the TCJA. The fourth quarter and full-year 2018 were favorably impacted primarily by tax benefits related to the TCJA, including certain 2018 tax initiatives as well as adjustments to the provisional estimate of the legislation, reported and disclosed within the applicable measurement period, in accordance with guidance issued by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:0px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:36px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:0px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">(5)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Non-GAAP Adjusted income and its components and Non-GAAP Adjusted diluted EPS are not, and should not be viewed as, substitutes for U.S. GAAP net income and its components and diluted EPS. Despite the importance of these measures to management in goal setting and performance measurement (as described in the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Financial Review&#8211;&#8211;Non-GAAP Financial Measure (Adjusted Income)</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;section of Pfizer&#8217;s 2018 Financial Report, which was filed as Exhibit 13 to Pfizer&#8217;s Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2018), Non-GAAP Adjusted income and its components and Non-GAAP Adjusted diluted EPS are non-GAAP financial measures that have no standardized meaning prescribed by U.S. GAAP and, therefore, are limited in their usefulness to investors.&#160;Because of their non-standardized definitions, Non-GAAP Adjusted income and its components and Non-GAAP Adjusted diluted EPS (unlike U.S. GAAP net income and its components and diluted EPS) may not be comparable to the calculation of similar measures of other companies.&#160;Non-GAAP Adjusted income and its components and Non-GAAP Adjusted diluted EPS are presented solely to permit investors to more fully understand how management assesses performance.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:0px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:36px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:0px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">(6)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Exclusive of amortization of intangible assets, except as discussed in footnote (7) below.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:0px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:36px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:0px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">(7)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Amortization expense related to finite-lived acquired intangible assets that contribute to our ability to sell, manufacture, research, market and distribute products, compounds and intellectual property is included in </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Amortization of intangible assets</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;as these intangible assets benefit multiple business functions. Amortization expense related to intangible assets that are associated with a single function is included in </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Cost of sales, Selling, informational and administrative expenses</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and/or </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Research and development expenses</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, as appropriate.</font></div></td></tr></table><div><br></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">- </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">30</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;-</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:3pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:3pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">PFIZER INC. AND SUBSIDIARY COMPANIES</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">NOTES TO RECONCILIATION OF GAAP REPORTED TO NON-GAAP ADJUSTED INFORMATION</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">PFIZER INC. AND SUBSIDIARY COMPANIES</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">NOTES TO OPERATING SEGMENT INFORMATION - (UNAUDITED)</font></div></div><div><br></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:0px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:36px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:0px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">(1)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">At the beginning of our 2019 fiscal year, we began to manage our commercial operations through a new global structure consisting of three distinct business segments: Pfizer Biopharmaceuticals Group (Biopharma), Upjohn and through </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">July&#160;31, 2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, Consumer Healthcare. See footnote (2) below for additional information.</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:0px;text-align:left;padding-left:36px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Additionally, certain costs and expenses are now managed in different parts of the organization than they were prior to the reorganization. We have revised prior-period information (Revenues and Earnings, as defined by management) to conform to the current management structure.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:0px;text-align:left;padding-left:36px;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">On July 31, 2019, we completed the transaction in which we and GlaxoSmithKline plc (GSK) combined our respective consumer healthcare businesses into a new consumer healthcare joint venture that operates globally under the GSK Consumer Healthcare name. In exchange for contributing our Consumer Healthcare business to the joint venture, we received a 32% equity stake in the new company and GSK owns the remaining 68%. Upon the closing of the transaction, we deconsolidated our Consumer Healthcare business and recognized a pre-tax gain of</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$8.1 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;(</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$5.4 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">net of tax)</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">in our fiscal third quarter of 2019 in (</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Gain) on completion of Consumer Healthcare JV transaction </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">for the difference in the fair value of our 32% equity stake in the new company and the carrying value of our Consumer Healthcare business. In accordance with our domestic and international reporting periods, our financial results, and our Consumer Healthcare segment&#8217;s operating results, for full-year 2019 reflect seven months of Consumer Healthcare segment domestic operations and eight months of Consumer Healthcare segment international operations. We record our share of earnings from the Consumer Healthcare joint venture on a quarterly basis on a one-quarter lag in </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Other (income)/deductions&#8211;&#8211;net</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;commencing from August 1, 2019. Therefore, we recorded our share of two months of the joint venture&#8217;s earnings generated in the third quarter of 2019 in our operating results in the fourth quarter of 2019.</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">As of the July 31, 2019 closing date, the fair value of our investment in GSK Consumer Healthcare was approximately </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$15.7 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:0px;text-align:left;padding-left:36px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The financial results of Array BioPharma Inc. (Array) are included in our consolidated financial statements commencing from the acquisition date of July 30, 2019.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:0px;text-align:left;padding-left:36px;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The financial results of Therachon Holding AG (Therachon) are included in our consolidated financial statements commencing from the acquisition date of July 1, 2019. Therefore, in accordance with our international reporting period, our financial results for the</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">fourth quarter</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">of 2019 reflect three months and for </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">full-year</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;reflect five months of Therachon operations. In connection with this asset acquisition, we recorded</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;a charge of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$337 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">in </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Research and development expenses </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">in our fiscal third quarter of 2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:0px;text-align:left;padding-left:36px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Certain amounts in the operating segment information and associated notes may not add due to rounding. </font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:0px;padding-bottom:0px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:36px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:0px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">(2)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Amounts represent the revenues and costs managed by each of the Biopharma and Upjohn reportable operating segments for the periods presented. The expenses generally include only those costs directly attributable to the operating segment. The segment information presents the three and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">twelve months</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;ended </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;text-align:center;">December&#160;31, 2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;text-align:center;">December&#160;31, 2018</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. Subsidiaries operating outside the U.S. are included for the three and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">twelve months</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;ended </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">November&#160;30, 2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">November&#160;30, 2018</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.</font></div></td></tr></table><div><br></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">- </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">33</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;-</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:3pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:3pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">PFIZER INC. AND SUBSIDIARY COMPANIES</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">NOTES TO Vaccines and Internal Medicine. The Hospital unit commercializes our global portfolio of sterile injectable and anti-infective medicines and includes Pfizer&#8217;s contract manufacturing operation, Pfizer CentreOne. At the beginning of our 2019 fiscal year, we also incorporated our biosimilar portfolio into the Oncology and Inflammation &amp; Immunology business units and certain legacy established products into the Internal Medicine business unit. Each business unit is committed to delivering breakthroughs that change patients&#8217; lives.</font></div></td><td </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">5.1</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;percentage points </font><font style="font-size:10pt;">driven by lower Lyrica royalty expense for Lyrica due to the patent expiration.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:0px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; AND SUBSIDIARY COMPANIES</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">NOTES TO OPERATING SEGMENT INFORMATION - (UNAUDITED)</font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-left:54px;padding-bottom:1px;padding-top:4px;text-align:left;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">for certain science-based and other platform-services organizations, which provide end-to-end technical expertise and other services to the various R&amp;D projects, as well as the Worldwide Medical and Safety group, which ensures that Pfizer provides all stakeholders</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">&#8211;&#8211;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">including patients, healthcare providers, pharmacists, payers and health authorities</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">&#8211;&#8211;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">with complete and up-to-date information on the risks and benefits associated with Pfizer products so that they can make appropriate decisions on how and when to use Pfizer&#8217;s medicines.</font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:0px;padding-bottom:1px;font-family:Times New Roman; GPD is responsible for facilitating all regulatory submissions and interactions with regulatory agencies. </font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:0px;padding-bottom:1px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:54px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:36px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">(c)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Other</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">&#8211;&#8211;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">the operating results of our Consumer Healthcare business, through July 31, 2019, and costs associated with other commercial activities not managed as part of Biopharma or Upjohn, including all strategy, business development, portfolio management and valuation capabilities, which previously had been reported in various parts of the organization. While we do not manage our segments or have performance goals under such an allocated manner, we believe that some investors may find this information useful in their analyses.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:4px;text-align:left;padding-left:36px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The estimated Other costs generally associated with our operating segments do not purport to reflect the additional amounts that each of our operating segments would have incurred had each segment operated as a standalone company during the periods presented. </font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:4px;text-align:left;padding-left:36px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">For information purposes only, for </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">full-year</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;text-align:center;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, we estimate that Other costs attributable to our Biopharma and Upjohn segments, as described above, for combined WRDM, GPD and other business activities costs are </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$6.4 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, and combined Corporate and Other Unallocated costs are </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$4.8 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, which excludes income and costs associated with our Consumer Healthcare business. The combined Corporate and Other Unallocated costs also exclude (i) net interest-related expense not attributable to an operating segment included in Corporate (approximately </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$1.4 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;for </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">full-year</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;text-align:center;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Other (income)/deductions&#8211;&#8211;net</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">); and (ii) net income from investments and other assets not attributable to an operating segment included in Corporate (approximately </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$318 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;for </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">full-year</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;text-align:center;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Other</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">(income)/deductions&#8211;&#8211;net</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">).
